title: Newcastle fan  stabbed three time in Milan attack ahead of Champions League match
body_text:
Newcastle fan 'stabbed three times' in Milan attack ahead of Champions League match
Eddie McKay had arrived in Italy with plans to watch the match with his son and a friend when it is said he was set upon by a group of men
Newcastle United have said they are “deeply concerned” by reports that a football fan was stabbed in Milan, Italy on Monday night. Eddie McKay, a 58-year-old who was planning to attend the match with his son and a friend, was taken to hospital following the incident.
Reports say he was stabbed three times - once in the back and twice in his arm. He is said to remain in hospital where he is in a stable condition.
According to the Mirror the city centre attack came ahead of the Magpies’ match against AC Milan on Tuesday - its first Champions League fixture in 20 years. Pictures posted online showed a man with a bloodied torso lying on the ground.
Graphic images published on social media showed the fan, covered in blood, being attended to by paramedics. It has been reported that he was set upon by a group of seven to eight locals nearing midnight.
A Newcastle United spokesperson said: “We are deeply concerned by reports that a supporter was seriously assaulted in Milan on Monday evening and we are liaising with local authorities to understand the circumstances. Our thoughts are with the supporter and their family and we hope for a full and speedy recovery.”
Milano Today reported that the man had been stabbed twice in the arm and once in the back. It said he was taken to hospital where his condition was improving.
More than 4,000 fans have made the trip from north east England despite complaints of prices soaring. It has been reported that hotel prices more than doubled and flights at astronomical rates.
Meanwhile, Newcastle could be reprimanded by UEFA after they arrived late in Milan last night. Clubs must be present for media duties between midday and 8pm in the city their game is set to take place but owing to bad weather in the area the team’s flight was delayed.
Eddie Howe and new midfielder Sandro Tonali, formerly of Milan, did get to a press conference later than the deadline but owing to the circumstances the governing body are expected to just provide the club with a warning.
